document.heading: Incarceration to Incorporation Entrepreneurship Program Act of 2016

To establish the Incarceration to Incorporation Entrepreneurship Program within the Department of Employment Services to educate, train, and assist returning citizens in becoming responsible entrepreneurs, to require the Department of Employment Services and the Department of Small and Local Business Development to operate the program, and to establish the Incarceration to Incorporation Entrepreneurship Fund.

history.summary: Law 21-159 requires the Department of Employee Services (DOES) and the Department of Small and Local Business Development (DSLBD) to establish a business development program for returning citizens called the Incarceration to Incorporation Entrepreneurship Program (IIEP). Among other things, the program will provide a fast track GED program, business training, and scholarships for returning citizens to enroll in business classes at the University of the District of Columbia. Within one year of the law's applicability date, and by June 1 every year, thereafter, DOES shall report on the operations of the IIEP to the Mayor and Council. FUNDING NOTE - This law is Subject to Appropriations. See Fiscal Impact Statement in "Other Documents" tab.
history.committee: Committee on Business, Consumer, and Regulatory Affairs

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Incarceration to Incorporation Entrepreneurship Program Act of 2016".
